data.sentence: The word يَوْمًا comes from the root ي و م and is associated with the meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.

data.meanings: to leave/forsake/neglect, fall upon, wound, cut in slices, let, desist.
data.sentence: The word وَيَذَرُونَ comes from the root و ذ ر and is associated with the meanings: to leave/forsake/neglect, fall upon, wound, cut in slices, let, desist.
The word يُحِبُّونَ comes from the root ح ب ب and is associated with the meanings: To love, like, wish.

data.meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.
data.sentence: The word الْعَاجِلَةَ comes from the root ع ج ل and is associated with the meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.

data.meanings: made/produce fire, allude to equivocally/ambigiously, meant such a thing pretended another, hide/conceal/cover, behind a thing covering/concealing, aider/follower, The Book of The Law (revealed to Moses).
data.sentence: The word وَرَاءَهُمْ comes from the root و ر ي and is associated with the meanings: made/produce fire, allude to equivocally/ambigiously, meant such a thing pretended another, hide/conceal/cover, behind a thing covering/concealing, aider/follower, The Book of The Law (revealed to Moses).

data.meanings: to be heavy/weighty, slow/dull/sluggish, difficult/hard/grievous. thaqalaan (dual of thaqalan) - two big and weighty things, two armies. athqaal (pl. of thiql) - burden. thaqiil (pl. thiqaal) - heavy. mithqaal - weight, weight of a balance. tathaaqal - to be dull/sluggish. thaqala - to grow heavy, oppress, weigh down. mathqalatun - burdened, heavily laden, any cause of depriving a mother of her child. iththaqala (for tathaaqala) - to be born down heavily, incline heavily downwards.
data.sentence: The word ثَقِيلًا comes from the root ث ق ل and is associated with the meanings: to be heavy/weighty, slow/dull/sluggish, difficult/hard/grievous. thaqalaan (dual of thaqalan) - two big and weighty things, two armies. athqaal (pl. of thiql) - burden. thaqiil (pl. thiqaal) - heavy. mithqaal - weight, weight of a balance. tathaaqal - to be dull/sluggish. thaqala - to grow heavy, oppress, weigh down. mathqalatun - burdened, heavily laden, any cause of depriving a mother of her child. iththaqala (for tathaaqala) - to be born down heavily, incline heavily downwards.
